attributes.action: Raise Approved Mileage Allowance Payment (AMAP) from the current rate of 40 pence per mile
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In light of the decision to raise advisory fuel rates for using
     company cars, it remains unfair that the thousands using
     private cars for work continue to be penalised by rates set in
     2002 when petrol cost around 74p per liter. With prices now hitting over 115p
     (56% rise) it’s time the government acknowledged this rise.
       Since 2002 advisory fuel rates have risen by 5p per mile. The
     most recent change, (1st June 2008) acknowledges this; “we are
     mindful that an implementation date of 1 July might mean that
     drivers will be incurring higher fuel prices before the new
     rates become effective”.  Given that the government
     acknowledges the increased cost for using company cars it can
     no longer ignore the cost for the use of private cars used for work.
       We urge the government to review the Approved Mileage
     Allowance and as a minimum raise it immediately by 5p per mile
     in line with the agreed rise for company cars since 2002. We
     also urge the government to commit to reviewing Approved
     Mileage Allowance every 6 months, as it is committed to do for
     the use of company cars. Any raises given for Advisory Fuel
     Rates should be reflected in Approved Mileage Allowance.
